thread.title: Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant

title: Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant
text:
Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant Lamar Odom may need a kidney transplant as his medical treatment continues in Los Angeles, a person with knowledge of his condition told USA TODAY Sports on Tuesday. Post to Facebook Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant Lamar Odom may need a kidney transplant as his medical treatment continues in Los Angeles, a person with knowledge of his condition told USA TODAY Sports on Tuesday.  //on.11alive.com/1LIOS3a   Join the Conversation To   Lamar Odom on kidney dialysis, may need transplant USA Today Network Martin Rogers, USA TODAY Sports 2:24 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Lamar Odom has been moved from a hospital in Las Vegas to one in Los Angeles. (Photo: Angela Weiss, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Lamar Odom may need a kidney transplant as his medical treatment continues in Los Angeles, a person with knowledge of his condition told USA TODAY Sports on Tuesday. 
The person asked not to be named due to the sensitivity of the matter and because Odom is receiving ongoing treatment. 
Odom was transported from Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas to Cedars-Sinai in Los Angeles on Monday night. The person said that while he would continue to undergo regular kidney dialysis treatment, a transplant was a “viable possibility at some stage.” Lamar Odom and then-wife Khloe Kardashian arrive at the Philippe Restaurant West Hollywood grand opening in Oct. 2009. Jason Merritt, Getty Images From left, Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner, Lamar Odom, Khloe Kardashian and Kourtney Kardashian at the Teen Choice Awards in Aug. 2010. Chris Pizzello, AP Lamar Jr., Lamar Odom, daughter Destiny, Khloe Kardashian, Kendall Jenner, Kim Kardashian, Kylie Jenner and Kourtney Kardashian at the 2011 Teen Choice Awards held at the Gibson Amphitheatre in Aug. 2011. Jason Merritt, Getty Images Khloe Kardashian called hubby Lamar Odom her "Lammy." But sadly, the union didn't last. Evan Agostini, AP A photo from Season 12 of 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians,' the family's hit E! show. From left: Kendall Jenner, Rob Kardashian, Scott Disick, Kourtney Kardashian, Lamar Odom, Khloe Kardashian Odom, Kim Kardashian, Bruce Jenner, Kris Jenner and Kylie Jenner. E! Entertainment Khloe and Lamar Odom seemed so happy for so long. Here they are in 2010 at an event in Hollywood. Jason LaVeris, FilmMagic Lamar Odom and Khloe Kardashian on June 7, 2012, in Orange, Calif. Jason LaVeris, FilmMagic Fullscreen Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom and his wife, Khloe Kardashian, pose with his trophy as the winner of the 2010-2011 NBA Sixth Man Award, as the basketball league's top reserve, at a news conference in Los Angeles on April 19, 2011. Reed Saxon, AP Khloe Kardasian and Lamar Odom debut their unisex fragrance Unbreakable at Perfumania in Orlando, Fla., on Feb. 12, 2011. Roberto Gonzalez, AP Khloe Kardashian and Lamar Odom, of the Dallas Mavericks, sit rinkside as they take in an NHL hockey game between the Chicago Blackhawks and the Dallas Stars on March 16, 2012, in Dallas. Tony Gutierrez, AP Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Last Slide Next Slide 
Odom was found unresponsive at a Nevada brothel called the Love Ranch last Tuesday, following a three-day stay at the establishment. Police were told that he had used cocaine and sexual-enhancement supplements in the preceding days. 
He suffered several strokes and multiple organ failure, and while other organs have returned to functionality, his kidneys are still failing, the person said.
